title: Stir-Fried Sticky Rice
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
ingredients: - 6 ounces lap cheong (Chinese sausage), cut into 1/2-inch pieces
- 3 ounces lap yuk (Chinese cured pork belly), cut into 1/2-inch pieces
- 2 scallions, white and green parts separated and sliced thin
directions: 1. Soak rice in 6 cups warm water (110°F) for 45 minutes. Rinse and drain well; set aside.
2. Microwave 1 cup water and mushrooms in a covered bowl until steaming, about 1 minute. Let sit for 5 minutes, then remove mushrooms, discard liquid, squeeze dry, stem, and chop.
3. Microwave 1 cup water and shrimp in a separate covered bowl until steaming, about 1 minute. Let sit for 5 minutes, then remove shrimp and discard liquid. Set aside with mushrooms.
4. In a bowl, whisk together Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, dark soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, salt, and pepper; set aside.

5. Beat eggs in a separate bowl. Heat an empty 14-inch wok over high heat until just beginning to smoke. Add 1 tablespoon oil around the perimeter and heat until just smoking. Add eggs, tilt wok to form a thin layer, and cook undisturbed until just set on the bottom, about 30 seconds. Fold into a half-moon and slide onto a plate. Cool slightly, then slice into 1/4-inch ribbons; set aside.

6. Reheat wok over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon oil and heat until just smoking. Add lap cheong and lap yuk; cook, tossing constantly, until fat begins to render, about 1 minute. Add mushrooms, shrimp, scallion whites, ginger, and sauce mixture; cook, tossing constantly, for about 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl.

7. Reheat wok over high heat. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil and heat until just smoking. Add soaked rice and cook, tossing constantly, until coated in oil. Stir in 1/2 cup water, reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook until absorbed, about 2 minutes. Repeat the process three more times with 1/2 cup water each, for a total of 2 cups water, until rice is fully cooked.
8. Stir in the sausage and mushroom mixture; cook until heated through, about 1 minute. Season with salt to taste. Sprinkle with scallion greens and top with egg ribbons before serving.
